content:
Here are some tips on how to get to Fushimi Inari Shrine, Tokyo Tower, and Tsukiji Fish Market from Shinjuku and Harajuku:

**Fushimi Inari Shrine:**

* From Shinjuku:
	+ Take the JR Nara Line from Shinjuku Station to Inari Station ( approx. 3 hours, ¥1,070).
	+ From Inari Station, follow the signs to Fushimi Inari Shrine (about a 5-minute walk).
* From Harajuku:
	+ Take the JR Yamanote Line from Harajuku Station to Kyoto Station (approx. 2.5 hours, ¥1,070).
	+ From Kyoto Station, take the JR Nara Line to Inari Station (approx. 5 minutes, ¥140).
	+ From Inari Station, follow the signs to Fushimi Inari Shrine (about a 5-minute walk).

Note: You can also consider taking a guided tour or a day trip from Tokyo to Fushimi Inari Shrine, which might be more convenient.

**Tokyo Tower:**

* From Shinjuku:
	+ Take the Tokyo Metro Marunouchi Line from Shinjuku Station to Akasaka-Mitsuke Station (approx. 10 minutes, ¥200).
	+ From Akasaka-Mitsuke Station, take Exit 6 and walk to Tokyo Tower (about a 10-minute walk).
* From Harajuku:
	+ Take the JR Yamanote Line from Harajuku Station to Hamamatsucho Station (approx. 10 minutes, ¥200).
	+ From Hamamatsucho Station, take the Tokyo Metro Oedo Line to Akabanebashi Station (approx. 5 minutes, ¥200).
	+ From Akabanebashi Station, take Exit 2 and walk to Tokyo Tower (about a 5-minute walk).

**Tsukiji Fish Market:**

* From Shinjuku:
	+ Take the Tokyo Metro Marunouchi Line from Shinjuku Station to Ginza Station (approx. 15 minutes, ¥240).
	+ From Ginza Station, take Exit C4 and walk to Tsukiji Shijo Station (about a 10-minute walk).
	+ From Tsukiji Shijo Station, take the Tokyo Metro Hibiya Line to Tsukiji Station (approx. 1 minute, ¥200).
	+ From Tsukiji Station, follow the signs to Tsukiji Fish Market (about a 5-minute walk).
* From Harajuku:
	+ Take the JR Yamanote Line from Harajuku Station to Shimbashi Station (approx. 10 minutes, ¥200).
	+ From Shimbashi Station, take the Tokyo Metro Ginza Line to Tsukiji Shijo Station (approx. 5 minutes, ¥200).
	+ From Tsukiji Shijo Station, take the Tokyo Metro Hibiya Line to Tsukiji Station (approx. 1 minute, ¥200).
	+ From Tsukiji Station, follow the signs to Tsukiji Fish Market (about a 5-minute walk).

Some general tips:

* Make sure to check the train schedules and plan your route in advance to avoid peak hour crowds and potential delays.
* Consider purchasing a prepaid IC card like Suica or Pasmo, which can make traveling on public transportation more convenient.
* Be prepared for crowds and lines at popular attractions like Fushimi Inari Shrine and Tsukiji Fish Market, especially during peak travel seasons.

I hope this helps, and you have a wonderful time exploring Tokyo!
